content: The purpose of magical realism in "The House of the Spirits" is to create a sense of the supernatural and blur the line between reality and fantasy, which allows for greater exploration of the themes of the novel. The use of magical realism also enhances the symbolic significance of objects and events, and it adds a layer of complexity to the novel's characters and plot. Additionally, it reflects the cultural heritage and worldview of the Latin American context in which the novel is set.
